contentrichtext.text: '''Chardon Lagache''' is a station on the [[Paris Métro]] in the [[16th arrondissement of Paris|16th arrondissement]], serving [[Paris Métro Line 10|Line 10]] (eastbound only). The station opened on 30 September 1913 as part of the extension of [[Paris Métro Line 8|line 8]] from ''Beaugrenelle'' (now ''Charles Michels'') to [[Porte d'Auteuil (Paris Métro)|Porte d'Auteuil]]. On 29 July 1937, line 10 was extended from [[Duroc (Paris Métro)|Duroc]] to [[La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle (Paris Métro)|La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle]] and the section of line 8 between ''La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle'' and ''Porte d'Auteuil'', including ''Chardon Lagache'' was transferred to line 10. The station is named after the street of ''Rue Chardon Lagache'', which was named after a local retirement home. {{s-start}} {{Paris Metro/next special|10|No service - Eastbound only'''<br>(Previous station:<br>'''[[Michel-Ange - Molitor (Paris Métro)|Michel-Ange - Molitor]]''')''' |[[Mirabeau (Paris Métro)|Mirabeau]]}} {{s-end}} ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Chardon-Lagache métro 03.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 10|Line 10]] platforms at Chardon Lagache File:Chardon-Lagache métro 02.jpg|Line 10 platforms at Chardon Lagache </gallery> {{commons category|Chardon-Lagache (Paris Metro)}} ==References== *Roland, Gérard (2003). ''Stations de métro. D’Abbesses à Wagram.'' Éditions Bonneton. {{Paris Metro/line 10}} {{coord|48.845138|N|2.266214|E|region:FR_type:landmark_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chardon Lagache (Paris Metro)}} [[Category:Paris Métro stations in the 16th arrondissement of Paris]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1913]] {{Paris-metro-stub}}
